description.value:
Characters who grow up in dwarven communities take on several distinctive cultural traits, in part due to their long history living underground. Dwarven culture values skill with traditional dwarven weapons and crafts, perseverance in labor, and the maintenance of their traditions.

Dwarven Combat Training. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.tzrQJXc2fh0bmVSq]{Dwarven Combat Training} You have proficiency with light and medium armor, as well as the battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, throwing hammer, and warhammer.

Tool Proficiency. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.SMqWbJoETxCTfTXK]{Tool Proficiency} You gain proficiency with one of the following tools of your choice: smith's tools, brewer's supplies, or mason's tools.

Stonecunning. @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.races.TdjVjyRkaSdCDk9j]{Stonecunning} Whenever you make an Intelligence check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

Languages. You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

Foundry Note

You can drag your choices from the above onto your character sheet and it will automatically update.
